revised_title: Purification and Properties of HlyX, a Potential Regulator of Haemolysin Synthesis
tldr: The authors purified HlyX, a protein potentially regulating haemolysin synthesis in Actinobacillus pleuropneumoniae, and studied its properties. HlyX is homologous to FNR, an anaerobic transcriptional regulator in Escherichia coli. HlyX has no haemolytic activity but may activate a latent haemolysin gene in E. coli. The protein functions as an anaerobic activator and repressor of FNR-regulated genes in vivo. The specificity for activating the haemolytic response requires unique features in both the N- and C-terminal segments of HlyX.
